column2: MeasurementOrFact
column4: A measurement of or fact about an rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource).

column2: measurementID
column4: An identifier for the MeasurementOrFact (information pertaining to measurements, facts, characteristics, or assertions). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

column2: measurementType
column4: The nature of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

column2: measurementValue
column4: The value of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.

column2: measurementAccuracy
column4: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

column2: measurementUnit
column4: The units associated with the measurementValue. Recommended best practice is to use the International System of Units (SI).

column2: measurementDeterminedBy
column4: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the value of the MeasurementOrFact.

column2: measurementDeterminedDate
column4: The date on which the MeasurementOrFact was made. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

column2: measurementMethod
column4: A description of or reference to (publication, URI) the method or protocol used to determine the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.

column2: measurementRemarks
column4: Comments or notes accompanying the MeasurementOrFact.

column2: A measurement of or fact about an rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource).

Resources can be thought of as identifiable records or instances of classes and may include, but need not be limited to Occurrences, Organisms, MaterialSamples, Events, Locations, GeologicalContexts, Identifications, or Taxa.
The recommended best practice is to separate the values with a vertical bar (' | ').
The weight of an organism in grams. The number of placental scars.

1963-03-08T14:07-0600 is 8 Mar 1963 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC,  "2009-02-20T08:40Z" is 20 Feb 2009 8:40am UTC,  "1809-02-12" is 12 Feb 1809,  "1906-06" is Jun 1906,  "1971" is just that year,  "2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z" is the interval between 1 Mar 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC,  "2007-11-13/15" is the interval between 13 Nov 2007 and 15 Nov 2007.
minimum convex polygon around burrow entrances for a home range area,  "barometric altimeter" for an elevation.
